meanings.definition: Fledgiest: superlative form of fledgling, meaning the most inexperienced or immature
meanings.sent1: The fledgiest bird in the nest struggled to fly.
meanings.sent2: The baby bird was the fledgiest of them all.
meanings.sent3: The fledgiest squirrel in the park tried to climb a tree but kept slipping.
meanings.sent4: Her fledgiest attempt at baking cookies resulted in a burnt mess.
meanings.sent5: The fledgiest swimmer in the race barely made it across the pool.

meanings.definition: Fledgiest: superlative form of fledgling, meaning the most recently hatched or born
meanings.sent1: The fledgiest chicks in the coop chirped loudly for food.
meanings.sent2: The fledgiest ducklings followed their mother to the pond.
meanings.sent3: The fledgiest puppies in the litter tumbled over each other in play.
meanings.sent4: The fledgiest flowers in the garden bloomed after the rain.
meanings.sent5: The fledgiest kittens in the box mewed softly for attention.
